programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic English Football League clash. Here, Sheffield United and Wolves meet in the First Division play-off final at the Millennium Stadium in Cardiff back in 2003.

programme.desc: A chance to relive the memorable 2010 Championship play-off final, as Blackpool and Cardiff City go head-to-head at Wembley in a thrilling final with a lot on the line.

programme.desc: All the way from 1993 through to 2019, take a look back over the years and enjoy the very best moments from the League 1 and 2 Play-Off finals.

programme.desc: Relive a classic clash from the English Football League. Here, Nottingham Forest face Yeovil in their Sky Bet League One play-off semi-final second leg at the City Ground in 2007.

programme.title: EFL 08/09: Cardiff v Swansea
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic clash from the English Football League. Here, Cardiff City meet Swansea City in a thrilling south Wales derby at Ninian Park in 2009.

programme.title: EFL 08/09: Millwall v Scunthorpe
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic clash from the English Football League. Here, Millwall face Scunthorpe at Wembley Stadium in the League 1 play-off final in 2009.

programme.title: EFL 09/10: Sheff Utd v Sheff Weds
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic clash from the English Football League. Here, Sheffield United and Sheffield Wednesday meet in a thrilling Steel City derby in September 2009.

programme.desc: A look back at some famous matches from yesteryear. Here, Chelsea face Tottenham Hotspur in the final of the Capital One Cup at Wembley Stadium in 2015.

programme.title: SPFL: There's Only One Sauzee
programme.desc: Hibernian legend Franck Sauzée sits down with Luke Shanley to reflect on his time in Leith as a Hibs player and manager, and recollect his Champions League success with Marseille in 1993.

programme.title: SPFL: Dundee United - Champions 83
programme.desc: This is the story of Dundee United's 1982-83 title triumph under the revolutionary management of Jim McLean. With interviews from club legends including Paul Hegarty and Maurice Malpas.

programme.title: ATP Final: Montreal 2024
programme.desc: Andrey Rublev competes in his sixth ATP Masters 1000 final, as the world number six faces a player appearing in his first, Alexei Popyrin. Who will be crowned Montreal champion? (12.08)

programme.title: WTA Final: Toronto 2024
programme.desc: Defending champion Jessica Pegula meets Amanda Anisimova in an all-American Toronto final. Anisimova enters the contest as the lowest-ranked finalist of the past four decades. (12.08)

programme.title: Raducanu v Fernandez 2021
programme.desc: Going 10 rounds without dropping a set, Great Britain's Emma Raducanu claimed the women's title at the 2021 US Open, becoming the first-ever qualifier to win a singles Grand Slam.

programme.title: Graf v Seles 1995
programme.desc: Two greats of professional tennis contested the 1995 women's singles final at the US Open, as Monica Seles - returning from a terrifying on-court ordeal in 1993 - faced Steffi Graf.

programme.title: Venus v Serena 2001
programme.desc: The 2001 US Open women's singles final witnessed the first career Grand Slam final meeting between Venus and Serena Williams. At just 21 and 19 years old, the pair would go on to dominate.

programme.title: US Open '24 Men's Final
programme.desc: A look at the 2024 US Open men's singles final, as the home hope Taylor Fritz attempted to end a 21-year wait for an American man to win a Grand Slam title against Jannik Sinner of Italy.

programme.title: US Open '24 Women's Final
programme.desc: A look at the 2024 US Open women's singles final, when New York's own Jessica Pegula entered her first Grand Slam final against Aryna Sabalenka as a first-time winner was crowned on Ashe.

programme.title: Stosur v Serena 2011
programme.desc: Sam Stosur fought Serena Williams, a 13-time Grand Slam champion, in the final of the women's singles at the 2011 US Open. Williams hadn't dropped a set in the tournament.

programme.title: US Open '24: Evans v Khachanov
programme.desc: Britain's Dan Evans challenges the 2022 US Open semi-finalist Karen Khachanov as the pair compete for a spot in the second round of the men's singles at the New York Slam.

programme.title: US Open '24: Paolini v Andreescu
programme.desc: Jasmine Paolini entered the 2024 US Open a Roland Garros and Wimbledon finalist in the same season, as the Italian got underway in New York against former champion Bianca Andreescu.

programme.title: US Open '24: Tiafoe v Shelton
programme.desc: In a rematch of last year's epic quarter-final meeting, countrymen Ben Shelton and Frances Tiafoe prepare to meet again as the Americans square off on Arthur Ashe at the US Open.

programme.title: US Open '24: Zheng v Vekic
programme.desc: Qinwen Zheng and Donna Vekic relive their gold-medal match under the Arthur Ashe lights at the US Open. It was China's Zheng who prevailed in Paris to become Olympic champion.

programme.title: US Open '24: Dimitrov v Rublev
programme.desc: Without dropping a set, Grigor Dimitrov arrived at the last-16 of the 2024 US Open where the veteran Bulgarian would stand across the net from a sixth-seeded Andrey Rublev.

programme.title: US Open '24: Navarro v Gauff
programme.desc: 2023 women's singles champion Coco Gauff looks to keep her title defence alive as she meets compatriot Emma Navarro, who defeated her Olympic teammate Gauff at Wimbledon.

programme.title: US Open '24: Fritz v Tiafoe
programme.desc: With the Arthur Ashe stage set, one man would realise the dream of a maiden Grand Slam final, as the American pair of Taylor Fritz and Frances Tiafoe clashed in the 2024 US Open semi-final.

programme.title: US Open '24: Pegula v Muchova
programme.desc: With a memorable win over the top seed under her belt, Jessica Pegula was a win away from a first Grand Slam final appearance as the American star fought Karolina Muchova at the US Open.

programme.title: US Open 2024 Review
programme.desc: From Jack Draper's breakthrough to New York's own Jessica Pegula competing in her first Grand Slam final, revisit the 2024 edition of the New York Slam with a review of all the action.

programme.title: Jack Draper's US Open
programme.desc: Revisit the story of Jack Draper's breakthrough tournament at the 2024 US Open, as the rising British star went all the way to the men's singles semi-finals at the New York Grand Slam.

programme.title: US Open '24: Draper v Zhang
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper takes to the court for a first-round encounter with 27-year-old Zhizhen Zhang of China at the 2024 US Open.

programme.title: US Open '24: Draper v Diaz
programme.desc: Jack Draper's US Open adventure continues with a second-round clash against Argentine Facundo Diaz Acosta. Draper's campaign began with victory in round one over Zhizhen Zhang.

programme.title: US Open '24: Draper v Zandschulp

programme.desc: Jack Draper's bid for a first Grand Slam quarter-final sees the British number one challenge Tomas Machac. Draper has matched last year's fourth-round run at Flushing Meadows.

programme.desc: Jack Draper's big moment arrives on Arthur Ashe Stadium as the British number one competes in his first Grand Slam semi-final against the world number one, Jannik Sinner of Italy.

programme.desc: Luigi's: Gordon Ramsay travels to Orange County, Southern California, to try to save Italian restaurant Luigi's from disaster.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Park's Edge: In Atlanta, Gordon helps first-time restaurant owners Richard and Jorge, whose establishment is in trouble due to their constant fighting, poor food and bad vibes.

programme.title: Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back
programme.desc: Save Our Town: Gordon helps three businesses in Ellicott City, Maryland, which suffered flood damage in 2016 and 2018. The job is so huge that Gordon dumps the 24-hour time limit.

programme.title: Babe
programme.desc: (1995) Charming family comedy-drama about a clever little pig who forms a close bond with a farmer and discovers a talent for herding sheep. With James Cromwell.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Tangerine Factor: When Penny breaks up with her boyfriend, Leonard plucks up the courage to ask her out. And each of them turns to Sheldon for advice about their date.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bad Fish Paradigm: Penny opens up to a reluctant Sheldon after a less-than-stellar first date with Leonard, putting him in the awkward position of having to keep a secret.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Codpiece Topology: Seeing Penny out on a date with another guy sends a distressed Leonard rushing back to Leslie Winkle, much to Sheldon's dismay.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Barbarian Sublimation: Penny becomes addicted to an online game based on the world of Conan the Barbarian and begins to pester Sheldon for advice.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Griffin Equivalency: Full of confidence after being named one of People magazine's '30 to Watch Under 30', Raj hits on Penny and becomes impossibly arrogant.

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
programme.desc: (2011) The third movie in the sci-fi action franchise. The discovery of a spacecraft on the dark side of the moon sparks another battle between the Autobots and the Decepticons.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Kill the Alligator and Run: Homer thinks he only has four years to live. So he takes the family on holiday to Florida, but does something foolish and gets into big trouble...

programme.title: The Simpsons: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Dangerous Curves: Homer and Marge head to a log cabin for the weekend and reminisce about their early courtship.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Throw Grampa from the Dane: The Simpsons visit Denmark and all fall in love with it - except Homer. Meanwhile, Grampa needs a serious operation.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: The Italian Bob: On a trip to Italy to find Mr Burns a new sports car, the Simpsons get stranded in a village where Sideshow Bob reigns as mayor.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Are We There Yet?
programme.desc: Missionary: Impossible: Homer pledges $10,000 to save his favourite British sitcom. But when the channel comes for the cash, he flees to a South Pacific island.

programme.title: New: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: Brand new series - Ricker Than Fiction: The new series continues. Rick and Morty take Hollywood.

programme.title: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: Brand new series - The CuRicksous Case of Bethjamin Button: Beth and Space Beth get nostalgic.

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen

programme.desc: What do the armchair critics make of The Crown; Victoria Derbyshire; The X Factor: Celebrity; The Andrew Marr Show; Panorama: The Prince and the Epstein Scandal; and First Dates?

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Gamer Lauren is looking for her perfect player number two to help her reboot her love life. And Ryan is searching for a silver fox with a dad bod.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Lucas's violent behaviour causes concern, and Dillon's at breaking point. A former resident is behind bars, Rex faces an ultimatum, and Grace wakes from her coma with a shocking revelation.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A shocking call reveals that a former resident is behind bars, while Rex faces a chilling ultimatum. Dillon takes courageous steps. And will a secret fling come to light?

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Grace wakes from her coma with a shocking revelation. Tony hosts a wine-tasting at The Hutch, where Marie senses a secret in the room... And someone's about to be exposed.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Mike and Nellie's: In Oakhurst, Gordon Ramsay helps the overwhelmed owner of Mike and Nellie's restaurant, who lost his way when his father and business partner died.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Great Louse Detective: When someone tries to murder Homer, Chief Wiggum seeks help from someone who understands the mind of a killer: Sideshow Bob.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Special Edna (a.k.a. Love and Marking): When Skinner stands up Mrs Krabappel to attend to his mother's whims, Bart nominates her for Teacher of the Year.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Pancake Sunday and Textbook Flirting: Mary struggles to make new friends while Mandy pushes Georgie to date another woman.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Ruthless, Toothless and a Week of Bed Rest: Sheldon learns that the university is building a database without him. Mary takes care of a bedridden Mandy and Meemaw.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Crazy Train: When Dede gets remarried, Manny convinces the family to take the train to the wedding. And Jay's ecstatic that Dede is moving on for good.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Double-Click: Claire can't seem to find the right time to fire an employee, Phil thinks he caught Luke with a girl in his bed, and no one notices that Alex has moved back.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Sleeper: When Phil fails to stay home and wait for the repairman, he tells an elaborate lie to hide the truth from Claire, but the stress is more than he can take.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Property Division Collision: Sheldon, Amy, Leonard and Penny attempt to divide up all their possessions. It doesn't go well.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Birthday Synchronicity: Sheldon and Amy try to celebrate her birthday with an intimate night at home but are interrupted when Bernadette goes into labour.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Holiday Summation: After spending Christmas apart, the gang gather at Penny and Leonard's flat and hear about Sheldon and Amy's terrible trip to Texas.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: German for Beginners and a Crazy Old Man with a Bat: The gambling room gets broken into. Sheldon wants to study abroad. And Missy makes a new friend.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Romantic Getaway and a Germanic Meat-Based Diet: Mandy surprises Georgie with a spa weekend and Sheldon prepares for his summer in Germany.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Snow Ball: Manny and Luke organise the school's lavish winter dance but end up in over their heads due to a texting error. Can they fix it before the end of the night?

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: The Predator
programme.desc: (2018) Unrestrained reboot of the franchise defined by a ruthless extraterrestrial killer whose name says it all... and it's had a DNA upgrade. All the better to kill you with, my dear.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: (2018) Dark sci-fi action with Tom Hardy as Marvel's anti-hero. A reporter becomes inhabited by a ferocious extraterrestrial that has its own ideas on how to behave. With Michelle Williams.

programme.title: Step Brothers
programme.desc: (2008) Outrageous comedy with Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly. When two 40-year-old man-children's parents marry, can the lads settle their differences and grow up? Strong language/nudity.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: (1984) It's time to put on make-up. It's time to light the lights. Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzy, the Blues one and the gang embark on a musical adventure as they try to make it on Broadway.

programme.title: Dr Who and the Daleks
programme.desc: (1965) A spin-off of the cult television series starring Peter Cushing. Backyard-inventor Dr Who finds himself stuck on the irradiated planet Skaro, home of the cold and metallic Daleks.

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: (1984) Comedy action adventure starring Michael Douglas and Kathleen Turner. An adventurer helps a bestselling author to search for her sister, who's been kidnapped in Colombia.

programme.title: A Beautiful Day in the...
programme.desc: ...Neighborhood: (2019) Biographical drama starring Tom Hanks as 'Mister' Rogers, the much-loved host of a kids TV show, who becomes the subject of a cynical journalist's article on heroes.

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle
programme.desc: (2017) Fantasy adventure sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black. Four teenagers are sucked into the Jumanji video game to complete a dangerous quest.

programme.title: Moonfall
programme.desc: (2022) Sci-fi disaster with Halle Berry. A NASA bigwig, a disgraced astronaut and a conspiracy theorist are all that stand between the Earth and a plummeting Moon. But are aliens involved?

programme.title: The Innocents

programme.title: Thunderball
programme.desc: Oscar-winning spy adventure starring Sean Connery, Claudine Auger and Adolfo Celi. A Nato aircraft has been stolen by criminal organisation Spectre and the world is threatened by its nuclear payload. Agent 007 is assigned to the case and the trail leads to the Bahamas and the sinister Emilio Largo.

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the seventh stage, a 197km route from St Malo to Mûr-de-Bretagne Guerlédan. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Jacopo Guarnieri and Alex Dowsett, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Eddie Kadi to try disco yoga, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform the look of a community fundraiser, and Heidi Phillip-Smith demonstrates more latte art

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: The chef is joined by actor and entertainer John Barrowman and prepares a selection of sweets and treats, starting with his cheesy, gooey souffle Welsh rarebit muffins. Former Great British Bake Off semi-finalist Briony May Williams makes a miso caramel and pear chocolate layer cake, while Olly Smith picks a range of drinks that are perfect for an indulgent moment,

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined for a chat by Danny Jones of McFly and actress Maureen Lipman, while horticulturist Camilla Bassett-Smith and carpenter Wayne Perrey join forces to help bring bees back to gardens. Sheep herder Meirion Owen introduces us to his latest border collie protege, RSPB wildlife gardener Adrian Thomas gives a lesson in birdsong, and drinks expert Andy Clarke celebrates Shakespeare's 460th birthday.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by comedian Stephen K Amos, who is served a peach breakfast crumble. Jimmy is at the wildlife park when vet Henry is doing the rounds, while Shivi heads off on her adventures again to learn about agroforestry.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and is cooking up a feast of delicious food for comedian Leigh Francis and Sue Cleaver from Coronation Street while also enjoying recipes from chefs John Hooker and Paul Rankin.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner celebrate the low-cost staple that is rice, starting with crispy rice with two deliciously moreish toppings that are great for entertaining too.They follow this up with Thai mango sticky rice, a Thai beef salad with a roasted rice dressing, and crispy Persian rice with spiced chicken

programme.title: Raymond Blanc's Royal Kitchen Gardens
programme.desc: Raymond visits Hillsborough Castle in Co Down, the official royal residence in Northern Ireland. He meets head gardener Claire and helps her with a spot of harvesting while learning about the gardens' extensive restoration, and also sees some of the extraordinary fruits grown there

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing Live from Newmarket
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of day three of the July Meeting from Newmarket, headlined by the July Cup. Plus, racing from York and Ascot. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Hayley Turner, and commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Two more of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Mark Chapman, Gillian Joseph, Ryan Sidebottom and Fred MacAulay pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Sweden v Germany (Kick-off 8.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' concluding match in Group C, held at Stadion Letzigrund in Zurich. Both these teams are already assured of their places in the quarter-final after wins over Denmark and Poland, but this contest will decide who tops the group. Germany have won 11 and lost just three of the 16 meetings between the sides, but it was Sweden who won the last high-profile contest involving the nations, prevailing 2-1 in the quarter-finals of the 2019 FIFA World Cup and going on to finish third in the tournament. They both enjoyed strong runs in the last staging of this competition in 2022, with Sweden reaching the semi-finals and Germany going one better, before both eventually succumbed to hosts England, and were the two pre-tournament favourites to progress from this group. With analysis from Eni Aluko and Vicky Losada, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Siobhan Chamberlain

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: Eddie teams up with Aadesh to clear their names. Natalie helps Vanessa and Scott in their quest. Katherine faces pressure to tell the truth.

programme.title: From the Ground Up
programme.desc: Can Ian Wright and coach Paul get their squad organised and Ten Em Bee FCÔÇÖs first-ever girlsÔÇÖ team into the league in time?

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: Noel and Liz Edmonds' River Haven business in Ngatimoti is still struggling, so the TV veteran and his team plan a huge celebration for car lovers to turn things around. Noel also hopes a VIP will agree to meet him for lunch, navigates problems with giant boulders in his energy garden, and has a romantic proposal for Liz

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage eight, a flat 171.4km route from Saint-Méen-le-Grand to Laval Espace Mayenne. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Alex Dowsett, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner celebrate the low-cost staple that is rice, starting with crispy rice with two deliciously moreish toppings that are great for entertaining too.They follow this up with Thai mango sticky rice, a Thai beef salad with a roasted rice dressing, and crispy Persian rice with spiced chicken

programme.title: Shark Tale
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure, featuring the voices of Will Smith, Jack Black, Renée Zellweger and Robert De Niro. Little fish Oscar yearns for a life of celebrity, so he collaborates with a vegetarian great white to dupe fellow fish into believing he's a heroic shark killer.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity founder, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Actress Penelope Keith, actor Robert Lindsay and musical theatre star Marisha Wallace join Alan at Manor Farm. Plus, horticulturalist Camilla Bassett Smith brings colour to autumn borders, and the Love Your Weekend greenhouse makes its debut

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities Rickie Williams, Melvin Odoom and Laura Crane, and those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce and Michelle Yeoh. Intending to reap the profits of increased ratings for his global multimedia empire, Elliot Carver attempts to ignite a conflict between Britain and China by sinking a British frigate and shooting down a Chinese fighter plane. The British Secret Service sends James Bond to verify suspicions that Carver is behind the incident.

programme.title: Preston v Liverpool Friendly
programme.desc: Preston North End v Liverpool (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the friendly at Deepdale. Preston finished 20th in the Championship last term and will look forward to testing themselves against the reigning Premier League champions, who have further strengthened their squad over the summer by signing the likes of full-backs Milos Kerkez and Jeremie Frimpong and attacking midfielder Florian Wirtz

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Cardiff for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: STV weather presenter Sean Batty explores more of the best places Scotland has to offer, beginning by travelling to the East Neuk of Fife. There he makes cheese, visits a secret bunker, has a dip in the Pittenweem tidal pool and learns about the wildlife and history of the Isle of May

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Fergus Sutherland takes a look back at the Ravenscraig steel plant in Motherwell and Jennifer Reoch learns about Edna Nellis, a pioneer of Scottish women's football

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: England v Wales (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of both teams' third and final Group D match, held at Arena St Gallen in Switzerland. England got their defence of the trophy off to a disappointing start with a 2-1 defeat at the hands of France, but then bounced back in style with a 4-0 win over the Netherlands. Wales are playing in their first Euros and have succumbed to three-goal defeats in each of their first two contests. The sides have not met since two FIFA World Cup qualifiers in 2018, when Wales earned a surprising goalless draw in Southampton, before the Lionesses prevailed 3-0 in Newport. With analysis from Emma Hayes, Karen Carney and Jayne Ludlow, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's classic adventure thriller, starring Roy Scheider, Robert Shaw and Richard Dreyfuss. The Atlantic resort of Amity Island is preparing for its lucrative summer season when death strikes in the form of a Great White shark. Rather than turn away business, Mayor Vaughn orders police chief Brody to keep the beaches open.

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Snetterton featuring racing from The Vertu MINI CHALLENGE and the Porsche Carrera Cup Great Britain.

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the ninth stage, a route of 174.1km from Chinon to Châteauroux. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Alex Dowsett, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants Alex Beresford, Sarah-Jane Crawford and Joe Absolom to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Plymouth couple Antony and Ricky, Greg and his boyfriend Augusto, and mother and daughter Georgia and Sally from North Bedfordshire try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Frank, Felicity, Sarah and Ryan pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Sarah is keen to fulfil her dreams as Cain and Charity want to help her, while Lewis is a success, but Nicola is frustrated

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: An agitated Mick reads a message on his burner phone, which leads to him breaking out of prison. Later, at the school, Daniel and Mrs Crawshaw are shocked to come face to face with Craig's killer, who tells them he wants Joanie. Elsewhere, Kevin makes a promise to Tyrone

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Lenny Henry, Lucy Punch, Helen George, Rachel Riley, Ade Adepitan, Dougie Poynter and Ross Noble head to the Bahamas to swim with man-eating sharks. Experts Danni Washington and Tristan Guttridge and shark attack survivor Paul de Gelder are the mentors whose mission is to help the celebrities conquer their fears and teach them to love this notorious predator

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: How Jaws Changed the World
programme.desc: Now 50 years old, Steven Spielberg's Jaws casts a long shadow on both the film industry and the fate of many shark species, leading to widespread slaughter around the world due to the fear it provoked in people. However, the movie also inspired a whole generation of marine biologists to specialise in sharks and this documentary reveals that much more is known now about this misunderstood species than ever before

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters

programme.title: How Jaws Changed the World
programme.desc: Now 50 years old, Steven Spielberg's Jaws casts a long shadow on both the film industry and the fate of many shark species, leading to widespread slaughter around the world due to the fear it provoked in people. However, the movie also inspired a whole generation of marine biologists to specialise in sharks and this documentary reveals that much more is known now about this misunderstood species than ever before

programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of day three of the July Meeting from Newmarket, headlined by the July Cup. Plus, racing from York and Ascot. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Hayley Turner, and commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Mark Chapman, Gillian Joseph, Ryan Sidebottom and Fred MacAulay pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: Sweden v Germany (Kick-off 8.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' concluding match in Group C, held at Stadion Letzigrund in Zurich. Both these teams are already assured of their places in the quarter-final after wins over Denmark and Poland, but this contest will decide who tops the group. Germany have won 11 and lost just three of the 16 meetings between the sides, but it was Sweden who won the last high-profile contest involving the nations, prevailing 2-1 in the quarter-finals of the 2019 FIFA World Cup and going on to finish third in the tournament. They both enjoyed strong runs in the last staging of this competition in 2022, with Sweden reaching the semi-finals and Germany going one better, before both eventually succumbed to hosts England, and were the two pre-tournament favourites to progress from this group. With analysis from Eni Aluko and Vicky Losada, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Siobhan Chamberlain

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: Eddie teams up with Aadesh to clear their names. Natalie helps Vanessa and Scott in their quest. Katherine faces pressure to tell the truth.

programme.title: From the Ground Up
programme.desc: Can Ian Wright and coach Paul get their squad organised and Ten Em Bee FCÔÇÖs first-ever girlsÔÇÖ team into the league in time?

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: Noel and Liz Edmonds' River Haven business in Ngatimoti is still struggling, so the TV veteran and his team plan a huge celebration for car lovers to turn things around. Noel also hopes a VIP will agree to meet him for lunch, navigates problems with giant boulders in his energy garden, and has a romantic proposal for Liz

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage eight, a flat 171.4km route from Saint-Méen-le-Grand to Laval Espace Mayenne. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Alex Dowsett, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner celebrate the low-cost staple that is rice, starting with crispy rice with two deliciously moreish toppings that are great for entertaining too.They follow this up with Thai mango sticky rice, a Thai beef salad with a roasted rice dressing, and crispy Persian rice with spiced chicken

programme.title: Shark Tale
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure, featuring the voices of Will Smith, Jack Black, Renée Zellweger and Robert De Niro. Little fish Oscar yearns for a life of celebrity, so he collaborates with a vegetarian great white to dupe fellow fish into believing he's a heroic shark killer.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity founder, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Actress Penelope Keith, actor Robert Lindsay and musical theatre star Marisha Wallace join Alan at Manor Farm. Plus, horticulturalist Camilla Bassett Smith brings colour to autumn borders, and the Love Your Weekend greenhouse makes its debut

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities Rickie Williams, Melvin Odoom and Laura Crane, and those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce and Michelle Yeoh. Intending to reap the profits of increased ratings for his global multimedia empire, Elliot Carver attempts to ignite a conflict between Britain and China by sinking a British frigate and shooting down a Chinese fighter plane. The British Secret Service sends James Bond to verify suspicions that Carver is behind the incident.

programme.title: Preston v Liverpool Friendly
programme.desc: Preston North End v Liverpool (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the friendly at Deepdale. Preston finished 20th in the Championship last term and will look forward to testing themselves against the reigning Premier League champions, who have further strengthened their squad over the summer by signing the likes of full-backs Milos Kerkez and Jeremie Frimpong and attacking midfielder Florian Wirtz

programme.title: In for a Penny

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: STV weather presenter Sean Batty explores more of the best places Scotland has to offer, beginning by travelling to the East Neuk of Fife. There he makes cheese, visits a secret bunker, has a dip in the Pittenweem tidal pool and learns about the wildlife and history of the Isle of May

programme.title: The People's History Show

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: England v Wales (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of both teams' third and final Group D match, held at Arena St Gallen in Switzerland. England got their defence of the trophy off to a disappointing start with a 2-1 defeat at the hands of France, but then bounced back in style with a 4-0 win over the Netherlands. Wales are playing in their first Euros and have succumbed to three-goal defeats in each of their first two contests. The sides have not met since two FIFA World Cup qualifiers in 2018, when Wales earned a surprising goalless draw in Southampton, before the Lionesses prevailed 3-0 in Newport. With analysis from Emma Hayes, Karen Carney and Jayne Ludlow, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: How Jaws Changed the World
programme.desc: Now 50 years old, Steven Spielberg's Jaws casts a long shadow on both the film industry and the fate of many shark species, leading to widespread slaughter around the world due to the fear it provoked in people. However, the movie also inspired a whole generation of marine biologists to specialise in sharks and this documentary reveals that much more is known now about this misunderstood species than ever before
